title: 401kbitcoin
author: 401kbitcoin
content: I am excited to share my latest YouTube tutorial on mastering the Bitcoin Lightning Network! In this quick guide, we show you how to seamlessly transfer Bitcoin from Binance to Kraken at lightning speed!Watch the tutorial here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tN3eBBPdQj8What you'll learn:Setting up Lightning Wallets on Binance and KrakenLightning-fast Bitcoin transfersInsider tips for successful transactionsJoin the crypto fun and level up your transfer game! Don't miss out – watch now and let us know what you think in the comments!

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: This is misleading, I'd say it's "How to send coins from Binance to Kraken" instead of Lightning Network tutorial. The real tutorial will give you a guide how to set up the wallet, how to open a channel, and how to fund it, those are the basic explanation. This is what exactly the Lightning Network Tutorial is https://medium.com/lightning-power-users/send-a-lightning-payment-with-zap-desktop-17b74b65b9b8

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: Quote from: bettercrypto on January 28, 2024, 02:17:56 PMWhen I send bitcoin from Electrum to Binance and there is a Lightning Network, can I send it directly? Or should I first download the tutorial on the medium platform you gave here, sir?Because I really want to learn to use LN, for example, if there is congestion in the Bitcoin network, LN is the alternative I will use so that the fee I can use when I transact is low. So I just noticed something like no Windows 64-bit? is thereBinance do accept both on chain and LN, if you have Bitcoin on chain just deposit to the deposit address, if you have Bitcoin in Lightning network just deposit to the invoice.Oh yeah you're correct, it seems zap discontinue their project, unfortunately I didn't find an easy solution to use LN in windows, what I found you need to run full node which takes time to sync your wallet https://medium.com/@johnny_pham/guide-setup-a-lightning-network-node-on-windows-8475206807fBut if you use Android or iOS version Open-source Lightning wallets, you don't need to sync your wallet.LN is a good solution for cheaper fees, the problem is you need to pay Bitcoin on chain fees to open the channel and convert the network (on chain to LN).

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: In this topic, [Table] All Lightning Network Threads In One Place, you will have many tutorial threads about Lightning Network. I believe those threads will be helpful for your guides.Very few exchanges have Lightning Network for deposit and withdrawal but basically if you can use Lightning Network from your non custodial wallet, it will be better than using centralized exchanges.The barrier is you have to open your Lightning Network channel, with an on chain transaction, before you can use LN as an off-chain solution for your bitcoin transactions.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: tbct_mt2 on January 28, 2024, 03:58:08 PMThe barrier is you have to open your Lightning Network channel, with an on chain transaction, before you can use LN as an off-chain solution for your bitcoin transactions.If fees are on the low side and you plan to use the channel for an extended period of time, opening the channel would not be a barrier at all . What complicates it is when users expect they can use LN to perform a single transaction and pay cheaper fees.
